data.body: In continuation of slave miner thing, rather than querying DeployedState from activities, it could get notification from the deploy module instead. If it gets deployed successfully then it continues mining. If it fails, it can find another spot to deploy.

data.title: GrantConditionOnDeploy::IsValidTerrain needs some modifications
Need a way to check Condition Token from other Traits.
data.body:
This may sound odd but RequiresCondition can't cover slave miners.

In original YR. slave miners deployed and became structures. When the miner is undeployed while its slave outside, the slaved unit management trait is passed to the vehicle so that slaves continue to exist.

The best way to implement this in OpenRA would be to start from Tick tank (TS) and not deploy into structures but just change graphically. Fine.

However, when it comes to deployedness checking, RequiresCondition is not enough.  This slave management unit is active whether it is deployed or not. However, whether it is fine to spawn the slaves or not depends on deploy condition.

data.title: Tesla Troopers (debugin)
data.body:
Hiya, Long time C&C fan here... while doing some skirmish mode fun I was just playing with the different unit types, and I went to train some Tesla troopers, which wouldn't be a issue.... but when I go to click on the unit before he says (Insert Arnold like voice clip here) the game crashes to windows and gives me a fatal error message. I don't know what this issue is as I've checked multiple times (even checked the error logs, but I couldn't find anything?) and still crashes the game. Just hope this message helps to get it noticed and fixed. I know it's a Aftermath unit but still a good unit, but one crashes the game, that's a big deal. I'm starting to like this program It has really improved since older versions, as obviously running old RA95 on win7 or 10 just ain't gonna happen otherwise, and I like the Tiberian sun\ RA2 style mechanics IE. flying rockets and projectiles, better resolution scaling + optimization for newer hardware & even still being able to install data from the old Cd's is great. So just I hope I'd might help out with this "Fatal" in-game bug I found. C:

Thank you,
B.    Xplayer51

data.title: Successive orders
data.body:
As mentioned in this discussion : http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=302572#302572 , there seems to be a few bugs related to successive orders given with the Shift key (or work differently accross computers ?). I guessed I'd make 1 single post for it

- "A-move" : doesn't work with me (is it supposed to ?)
- MCV move & deployment : seems to either not work at all, or deploy at the first location of a path
- Repair at Service Depot : works with movement. But at the end of the last order, the unit then goes to the rally point of the SD. Can cause unintended behaviour

data.title: Fix the close enough check in Repair.cs
data.body:
Fixes #13384.

The problem is that the helicopter doesn't land at the center position, but is [offset](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/74437ed56ce044bdef2f99e8c26688c33c12d6bd/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Air/HeliReturnToBase.cs#L79).

data.title: Fix compilation with csc/msbuild on non-windows platforms
data.body:
Mono 5 now defaults to `msbuild` and the roslyn `csc` compiler.  Compiling the projects using XS/vs4mac fails because our AfterBuild tasks are expecting to see a mdb symbol file instead of a pdb.

This fixes these errors by checking against the files, not against of the OS.  It also cleans up some stray lines from OpenRA.sln.

Tested with mono 5 on macOS.  We need at least a test with mono 4.x on Linux and VS/.Net on Windows before merging.

data.title: Add AutoTargetPriority trait for smarter AutoTarget logic.
data.body:
This reworks our AutoTarget logic to add support for explicit target prioritization.

Some potential future use cases:
* Adding target prioritization to improve AI micromanagement, together with #13382.  E.g. "Hard AI" owned rocket troopers will attack tanks before infantry (see testcase commit).
* Implementing the proper C&C stance logic, together with #13371.  Units in the AttackAnything stance autotarget non-defense structures, but units in the Defense stance don't.
* Implementing the cut [threat rating node upgrade](http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Threat_Rating_Node_upgrade) in TS.

Performance-wise, i'm hoping this will roughly balance out -- we need to do a bit extra work per actor to query the target types, but actors that make use of the priorities win a lot by being able to skip actors of a lower priority before doing the weapon checks.

Unfortunately the haphazard spray of `AutoTarget` overrides across our default mod/map rules means that we can't implement a proper upgrade rule for this.  I took this opportunity to clean up our AutoTarget definitions across all four mods.

The [pchote/autotarget-types-testcase](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/autotarget-types-testcase) branch has two throwaway testcases for the new behaviour:
* Player controlled units will prioritize vehicles or tanks based on their damage type, illustrating the prioritization logic.
* Iron curtained units will stop AutoTargeting everything, illustrating the condition support.

Closes #3581.
Closes #10625.

data.title: Add bot type field and GrantConditionOnBotOwner
data.body:
Using the human-readable name as an internal identifier for bots is bad:
* It makes parsing more difficult than necessary (may contain spaces and other special characters).
* They break as soon as we want to translate them.

These are fixed by adding a new internal Type field that is used for client ⇆ server orders and the `PlayerReference.Bot` field (which isn't used in any of our default maps).

This also adds a new `GrantConditionOnBotOwner` trait that... grants a condition on an actor while it is owned by a bot (big surprise).  This can be used to apply difficulty modifiers or adjust the AutoTarget behaviour.

Testcase: Add the following to RA's `POWR` actor:
```
GrantConditionOnBotOwner:
	Condition: invulnerability
	Bots: rush, naval
```

Power plants built by Rush AI or Naval AI will be unvulnerable until captured by the player.

Closes #7625.

data.body:
* Replace `Lazy<T>` deferred trait queries with our newer convention of querying from `INotifyCreated`
* Explicitly implement interfaces.
* Avoid unnecessary direct `ResolveOrder` call from `Sandworm`.

data.title: Replace .Single with .First in WithTurretedAttackAnimation
data.body:
`First` is faster than `Single`, and we don't use `Single` anywhere else in our game logic code.

But more importantly, it is entirely possible that mods might want to 'share' an attack anim between two armaments (for example, dual-barreled units might need two armaments to fire from both barrels at the same time), so being forced to give one of them a different name just to avoid a crash is a bit inconvenient.

`WithAttackAnimation` is taken care of in #13350.

data.title: "Current cash" in replay
data.body:
Similar to the earning graph in the replays, could there be a "Current cash" graph ? 
(But not on a 1min timescale like the earning graph, that would be too imprecise. Maybe every 10 secs ?)

Could be useful to identify the moments when players are broke (or floating), therefore help to improve one's gameplay.

data.title: Fix missing-failing logging of Ruleset (Yaml)Exceptions
data.body:
Fixes missing log for exception e.g.:
Failed to load rules for Desert Shellmap with error System.AggregateException: One or more errors occurred. ---> OpenRA.YamlException: Actor type v2rl: Trait name Mobile: Required property missing: TerrainSpeeds

Abstract actor's trait with missing fields is ignored and this error/warning wasn't logged - added now to debug.log:
^vehicle: Trait name Mobile: Required property missing: TerrainSpeeds

data.title: Add condition granting support to AutoTarget.
data.body:
This allows traits to be toggled based on the current actor stance.  This can be used by mods to draw a stance decoration, and gives us the first half of the logic we need to properly implement the original game's autotarget behaviour.

As a testcase, this positions the health decoration on TD infantry in one of four corners based on the current stance.  This commit should obviously be removed before merging.

Supersedes #13275.
